attributes.action: Work with international community to end conflict between Azerbaijan and Armenia
attributes.background:
We would like the UK government to work with other countries and international bodies in brokering a resolution of the current conflict between Azerbaijan and Armenia.

To ensure the immediate withdrawal of Armenian troops from Nagorno-Karabakh and ensuring the territorial integrity of Azerbaijan.
attributes.additional_details:
As the UK is a major investor and beneficiary of the natural resources of Azerbaijan and an influential member in global politics, it has the ability to highlight the current dangerous escalation of violence and military action in the region.

This is significant as this could end with serious destabilisation in the region; it will cost lives and potentially end with both countries losing control of the current COVID-19 pandemic which could conclude with catastrophic consequences.

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

attributes.action: Require police disclose & allow reported Non-Crime Hate Incidents be challenged
attributes.background: Impose a statutory duty on each police force to give notice to individuals when Non-Crime Hate Incidents are recorded against them, and give them an opportunity to challenge the allegations within 28 days, with a right of appeal to the court, so that these reports can be deleted if unfounded.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment the police have recorded around 120,000 Non-Crime Hate Incidents. These are often not fully investigated. They are however recorded following a report by someone who experienced the incident as "hateful". These Incidents can be disclosed to potential employers on enhanced DBS checks, affecting employability. Often this is the first time it is revealed to the "perpetrator". This is a breach of the principle of natural justice.

departments.name: Home Office

attributes.action: All schools to be issued a portrait of Her Majesty the Queen this Jubilee Year
attributes.background: Each school should be issued with a portrait of Her Majesty the Queen in honour of her Platinum Jubilee, so that this can be displayed in a prominent area of the school.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only is this an appropriate way of celebrating Her Majesty’s 70 years on the throne, but I believe this idea will be popular and could help foster an atmosphere of unity and common celebration during this national event.
 
Since schools are public buildings funded by Her Majesty’s government, it is only natural that they be at the forefront of this national celebration unlikely to be repeated in our lifetimes.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Fund an NHS programme to allow women with Endometriosis to freeze their eggs
attributes.background: Women with endometriosis should have the option to freeze their eggs on the NHS, due to the high percentage of infertility (30-50%). Women undergoing chemotherapy have around a 40% chance of being infertile, yet they can get their eggs frozen on the NHS and women with endometriosis cannot.
attributes.additional_details:
Endometriosis is a debilitating disease where the lining of the uterus grows in ectopic sites, such as the ovaries, fallopian tubes and the pelvis. It occurs in 1 in 10 women but takes approximately 7 years to get diagnosed. 
Around 30-50% of women with endometriosis are infertile and as there is no cure for endometriosis, there are very limited options to conceive naturally. One way of managing symptoms is surgery, which actually increases the chances of infertility.
You have the power to help

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Protect Jones’ Hill Wood from being destroyed by HS2
attributes.background: Stop Jones’ Hill Wood from being destroyed due to HS2 development. Leave this beautiful, ancient woodland alone.
attributes.additional_details: Jones’ Hill Wood is a beautiful woodland area that inspired Roald Dahl to write ‘Fantastic Mr. Fox’. Not only is it a part of history but also a home for wildlife and a stunning place that people can visit. It allows for people to be educated on nature and offers them a stunning environment to enjoy.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Grant English and Welsh Pagans the same marriage rights as Scottish Pagans
attributes.background: Change English and Welsh marriage laws to recognize traditional Pagan wedding ceremonies in particular the practice of handfasting as a legal act of marriage. At present we must instead travel over the Scottish border to wed in accordance with our ancient faith. This is unfair and discriminatory.
attributes.additional_details: The prejudice and superstition that surrounds the over 53,000 Pagans in England today is very sad to witness. Many families have been practicing Paganism for generations, it is a long misunderstood faith that centers its beliefs in the natural world and doing only good. It is only the ignorance of others that prevents English pagans from being able to have equal rights in marriage. Legalizing Pagan wedding ceremonies will help to end the stigma that surrounds us, and give us the power to express our faith and worship freely.

departments.name: Home Office

attributes.action: Remove Clause 11 from the Nationality and Borders Bill
attributes.background:
Clause 11 allows for people granted protection in the UK to be given
different rights and entitlements, depending on the nature of their arrival to
the UK. We urge the Government to scrap the Clause, which could be used to penalise those who need our help the most.
attributes.additional_details: Clause 11 of the Bill would create a two-tier system where someone who was forced to take a dangerous journey to seek safety and did not have appropriate documentation could be treated differently from those who do, even if they are originating from the same area of conflict or persecution.

departments.name: Home Office

attributes.action: Allow the resumption of Indoor Tennis across the UK in Tier 2 and Tier 3.
attributes.background:
Petition for indoor tennis activity to be permitted to continue, on the basis of its socially distant nature, the significant health benefits it delivers and the stringent hygiene protocols that venues have put in place.
Current restrictions will significantly impact the future of community clubs.
attributes.additional_details:
Aside from the obvious physical benefits, playing tennis can positively effect the mental health of an individual. Tennis can improve critical thinking, mental alertness, and tactical thinking by making connections in the brain. Tennis also helps regulate serotonin—a brain chemical linked to functions such as sleep cycle, appetite, and emotional state.

Even seeing a socially distant smile at your local club can lift a mood which, in these difficult times, is invaluable.

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport

attributes.action: Ban Jetskis from coastal waters and inland waterways
attributes.background: Jetskis are a hazard to wildlife and the natural environment, often being driven too fast for wildlife and people to respond and get out of their way. Users sometimes harass and chase wildlife, they are often unable to see some flora and fauna which lies just below the surface.
attributes.additional_details: Our wildlife is in crisis and we must respond quickly.  There have been promises of more protection and reversing declines. Jetskis are designed for speed and thrills and in many cases are used in fairly shallow waters. They are not compatible with the protection of our marine environment in coastal waters and inland waterways.  Important flora and fauna can be harmed and disturbed by these speeding motorised water craft. Swimmers and divers can also be at risk of harm. We need an outright ban

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: A motion for the introduction of a Digital Data Dividend (The DDD)
attributes.background:
We ask the secretary of state for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport to table a legislative motion that ensures that UK citizens can share in the wealth that is created when companies process (and sell) their personal (digital) data. 

This is a natural evolution from GDPR regulation.
attributes.additional_details:
The motion should achieve the following:

1. Companies must use a uniformed mechanism on their website that enables people to opt out of their data being harvested - with a single click.

2. Companies must financially compensate people when they make money from selling their data. There are many ways to implement this, we believe that parliament is well equipped to explore and discuss the most elegant method.

More information is available here: https://www.theddd.co.uk/

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport

attributes.action: Immediately end all animal agriculture subsidies in the UK
attributes.background: The UK Government allocates around £3 billion per year in subsidies to agricultural industries, £700m of which subsidises animal factory farming.
attributes.additional_details: Factory farming is responsible for animal mutilation, hormone injections, cramped living conditions and slaughter. It harms our planet and our natural eco-systems. Even non-intensive animal agriculture is still cruel and bad for the environment.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Create statutory procedures for sexual offence complaints at university
attributes.background: The Government should require investigations into allegations of a sexual nature to be initiated and concluded with a month of being reported; that investigations be transparent; that complainants be informed of any penalties imposed, and that any offences be permanently recorded by the institution.
attributes.additional_details:
The current University rape culture needs to be addressed immediately, with greater urgency. I want the Government to implement a statutory procedure universities are required to follow when dealing with incidents of a sexual nature, that is consistent across all Universities.
 
Currently Universities are by no means an environment that students feel safe in. This is due to the lack of consequence for sexual assault allegations. Sexual assault cases rarely result in expulsion, meaning many victims are forced to see their abuser around campus. A statutory process should improve outcomes for victims.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Ban Animal Products
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that the government should and must cut all subsidies to animal farming and ban the sale, export and consumption of animal products including but not limited to: flesh, eggs, dairy, honey, leather, wool, fur, down.
attributes.additional_details:
The animal agriculture industry causes horrific damage to the environment, humans & non-human animals and to public health. The farming and consumption of animal products has been linked to health crises including vCJD, avian flu and antimicrobial resistance.
It is one of the biggest sources of GHGs and environmental destruction.
Animals live in brutal conditions in UK factory farms and die in pain & fear years before their natural life expectancy.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Abolish the Supreme Court and return power to the Lords of Appeal in Ordinary.
attributes.background: Abolish the Supreme Court and return its powers to the Lords of Appeal in Ordinary as it was before the Supreme Courts creation.
attributes.additional_details: The Supreme Court has overturned decisions of a political nature. I believe these actions represent a dangerous and undemocratic means of carrying out political action without any democratic mandate or control. The cases over our efforts to leave the EU made this danger perfectly clear and raised concerns regarding Parliamentary Sovereignty. We are not a US style republican system and do not practice the doctrine of separation of powers and so the Supreme Court should be reincorporated back into Parliament.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Introduce a levy on single-use disposable plastic
attributes.background:
I want the UK Government and Parliament to introduce a levy on single-use disposable plastic manufactured and sold in the UK.

This will help consumers, business and industry transition towards more sustainable solutions; ones that are long term and ones that consider the entire product lifecycle.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact of plastic pollution on our natural environment isn’t just a problem for the UK. It’s a global one. 

In 2021 the UK will host COP26 and the G7. Whilst SARS-CoV-2 (COVID19) will dominate the conversation, the UK must use these events to tackle plastic pollution as well as climate change and the effect it will have on our natural environment. 

This levy may create a fund for research into the effects of plastic pollution as well as solutions that may lead to an outright ban.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Protect our children’s heritage – increase funding for Natural England
attributes.background: Government should restore adequate funding for Natural England to protect nature for the health, well-being and heritage of our children. Since 2008 funding vital for work such as nature recovery, care for sites vital for endangered species, and for landscapes, has been cut by £165 million.
attributes.additional_details:
Natural England is no longer able even to fund urgent work to aid species in danger of extinction. Restoring the budget to 2008 levels only requires the equivalent of 12 days of the current road-building programme, or less than half that earmarked for filling potholes each year.  

At a time of ecological and climate emergency we need to enhance natural capacity to store carbon. We must not abandon the crown jewels of England’s natural heritage and impoverish our present, and our children’s future.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund at least one round of IVF regardless of partner's children
attributes.background: I want the criteria for IVF standardised across the country as everyone deserves the chance to be a parent. Fund at least one round for all those struggling to conceive, regardless of children from previous relationships.
attributes.additional_details:
Everyone deserves the chance to be a parent and I think it is unfair that through no fault of ours, our bodies can't do the one thing it should be able to.

The fact that you partner has children from previous relationships should not stop us women being able to become mums. Even if one round of iIVF was offered to women that can't conceive naturally then that would help us as gives us a chance at least.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Allow indoor/outdoor tennis courts to operate under strict distancing protocols
attributes.background: Allow tennis to be played indoors and outdoors as it’s a sport that naturally supports distancing, stimulates young minds and is more easily controlled.
attributes.additional_details: Support local communities by giving opportunities to stay physically active, to help with the pandemic through education of the virus and the protocols needed. We all have the responsibility to develop more focused minds and allows for better mental health through tough times.

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport

attributes.action: Commit to UK natural gas and increase investment
attributes.background: The Government should commit to developing natural gas from UK sources as a central part of its energy policy, including north sea production and fracking. As part of the transition to non-fossil fuels, Natural Gas will surely be required for decades before 2050.
attributes.additional_details:
It is not ‘green’ to bring it in by tanker from the USA. It is political madness to expose ourselves to supplies from overseas. 

The rising cost of natural gas need not be a global problem for the UK. We surely have enough to be self-sufficient. The transition to 2050 is a marathon, not a sprint. Common sense needs to be applied to managing the transition. The solution to the fuel crisis is supply, not convoluted subsidies. It is time Government adopted the old business maxim - Keep It Simple Stupid! (KISS).

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Require all CCGs in England to offer 3 rounds of IVF
attributes.background: For the sake of equality and fairness we need the government to hold local Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) to account and to legislate to ensure that access to IVF provision on the NHS is equal across England. All CCGs should be required to offer the same number of rounds of IVF on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Being unable to conceive naturally is not a choice that we make, it is an awful situation and everyone experiencing it should be able to access the treatment that NICE recommends! 80% of all CCGs do not follow the standards! This is unacceptable.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Make sanitary products freely available to all women
attributes.background: Menstruation isn’t a choice! Therefore all woman should have the right to free sanitary products, as it is a natural human process.
attributes.additional_details: It’s unfair to see so many women suffer as they have no access to these products. So why let them!

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Update the Equality Act 2010 to include hair texture as a feature of race
attributes.background: Section 9 of the Equality Act 2010 needs to be updated to explicitly include hair texture and hairstyles as a protected feature of race. This update will help protect individuals from discrimination for wearing their natural hair and reduce systemic racism in schools and in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
The Equality Act 2010 defines race to include colour, nationality and ethnic or national origins. But does not explicitly mention hair, which can be an indicative feature of African and Caribbean heritage.

Discrimination of black and dual heritage individuals with afro-textured hairstyles such as afros, braids and dreadlocks is unjust. Children are being suspended from schools for wearing their natural hair texture (BBC, 2020). Adults also face this same discrimination in the workplace (BBC, 2015).

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Ban MMA liquid use in the beauty industry
attributes.background:
More regulation health and safety at nail salons
MMA is used by salons all over the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
This dangerous substance can cause horrific damage to the natural nail, this needs to stop. Instead of breaking the enhancement, it has the strength to completely rip off your natural nails.
 
MMA liquid is banned in some states in the USA, it should be illegal to use in the UK. There are many cases where people are losing them natural nails because off the product what salons use.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Allow registration of births for all babies after a miscarriage.
attributes.background: In Jan 2020 I lost our baby girl at 17 weeks. Because she was over the amount of weeks for a D&C or to miscarriage naturally the only option I had was to give birth .If this wasn’t heart breaking enough I then was told because she was less than 24 weeks I couldn’t register her birth.
attributes.additional_details:
I saw our baby and she was perfect. We were able to have a funeral for her which I was extremely grateful for however I couldn’t register her birth because she was less than 24 weeks. 
 
If a women has to give birth to their child before the 24 week stage she should have the choice whether to register her child. If I now check our family tree our daughter Mia would not be on there.. almost like she doesn’t exist which is far from the case.. she was our daughter.. a part of our family

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Restrict sale of all rodenticide "poison" products to licensed users
attributes.background: We want the Government to restrict the sale of all rodenticide poisons to licensed pest control technicians. We feel this would lead to a reduction in secondary poisoning that inevitably goes on to kill their natural predators such as foxes, otters, stoats, owls, red kites, kestrels and peregrines.
attributes.additional_details: DIY stores and garden centres should promote non-lethal deterrents and mechanical traps which kill the victim instantaneously, not cruel and dangerous poisons. According to the charity Humane Society International, anticoagulant poisons make up 93% of all rodenticide authorised in the UK for sale to non-professionals. Animals inc non-target species like dogs and cats can suffer severe abdominal and muscle pain, weakness, lameness and breathing difficulties for up to 28 hours prior to death.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban fishing on a third of UK coastal for fish repopulation
attributes.background: “We have far too few marine sanctuaries. We need to turn a third of all our coastal seas into properly protected areas, if we do that, our fishing grounds would recover and help sustain both humanity and the natural world.” David Attenborough
attributes.additional_details: We are already in a climate crisis and in order to reverse the damage humans have created our oceans need to be healthy. Great biodiversity is needed to ensure healthy oceans. By creating no fishing zones this will also benefit fisherman as once there are more fish in the ocean they will spill into fishable zones. If we do not implement these measures everyone will suffer.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Make all Asthma medications exempt from prescription charges on the NHS
attributes.background: End all prescription charges for Asthma medications, such as Inhalers and Steroid Tablets, to help prevent hospitalisation of vulnerable asthmatics. Healthcare professionals and campaign groups have encouraged the removal of these charges, yet the Government has not taken action.
attributes.additional_details: It is outrageous that Asthma patients have to continuously pay prescription charges several times a year, just to receive the medication they need to breathe. This is literally putting a price on breathing, a natural activity everybody needs to survive, and is impacting vulnerable people who may end up in hospital due to not being able to afford these medications. Many triggers like Air Pollution are at no fault of the patients, and until this is sorted asthmatics will continue to suffer.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Provide Loans to Healthcare students wishing to study abroad due to COVID-19
attributes.background: Provide Student Finance Loans to Medicine, Dentistry and Veterinary Science UK Students who because of COVID-19, have not and will not be accepted to UK Universities (due to lower-grade predictions and inability to resit) and so as a result of this, are looking to study their desired degrees abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
Students of 2019, 2020 & 2021 were put at a disadvantage by having their grades selected for them. Many have and may miss university places.
The competitive nature of healthcare degrees puts these students at a disadvantage compared to those studying uncompetitive courses.
It prevents students from having to settle with studying degrees they never wanted to do.

With the situation of rising unemployment due to COVID, more pressure is added to parents paying their children's university fees abroad

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Fund Kuvan (sapropterin) on the NHS for people with PKU
attributes.background:
The drug Kuvan allows people with the rare condition PKU to manage their condition. The treatment has been licensed for 11 years but has never been commissioned by the NHS.
The government should make funding available for this treatment for all PKU patients that could benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
PKU is a rare condition, diagnosed at birth. People with PKU cannot process protein through their body properly and without careful management an amino acid (phenylalanine) causes brain damage. The only treatment funded by the NHS is a restricted diet containing virtually no natural protein. The PKU diet is stressful and difficult to cope with. Outcomes are variable.
Kuvan (sapropterin) is a life changing treatment available in almost every country in Europe. It needs to be available here.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Make transplant patients eligible for free prescriptions
attributes.background: Transplant patients need to take several medications daily, for the rest of their lives. Transplant patients are not on the list of people eligible for free prescriptions, despite the life-saving nature of the treatment required to maintain health and functioning of patients.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS facilitated nearly 4,400 transplants in 21/22. Those patients require medication to prevent rejection/complications to survive. Certain  medical conditions needing continuous dressings, life-long medication to manage (diabetes, epilepsy) make a person eligible for free prescriptions, but not being a transplant patient. No clear rationale is given as to why transplant is not included; impact of not taking required medication would put further strain on NHS services and can be severe, with this population.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Exempt new UK immigrants from rules on import of invasive species
attributes.background: I am BNO holder & keeping 3 red-eared sliders for 20 years. They are my most important property, which I will not release, trade nor breed. Due to the current situation in Hong Kong, I decided to leave, but the current restrictions on import of invasive species has caused problems.
attributes.additional_details:
UK can should exempt new UK immigrants from the restrictions on import of invasive species, such as the red-eared slider. Their import should be allowed, provided the animals are registered and release into nature is prohibited.
 
Acceptance of immigrants without their pets is also a kind of inhuman act. New UK immigrants should be able to bring pets to the UK with them.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund more frequent baby scans for pregnant women
attributes.background: The UK has some of the lowest scan rates in Europe, More scans need to be done during all pregnancies to increase the change of abnormalities being caught early. There were around 2000 stillborn babies in 2020, which accounts for around 4 in 1000 pregnancies.
attributes.additional_details: I had an uncomplicated natural birth for my first child and as such was considered low risk for my second. I fell pregnant with my second in early February 2020, at first scan was on the everything was perfect. My next scan was in May and then my third at 34 weeks in September. Only 3 scans in total over 9 months. As it happened I had gone back to Poland and paid for a scan to be done while I was there and found my son had what appeared to be Hydrocephalus.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Fund the use of environmentally friendly PPE in hospitals and care settings
attributes.background: We want the government to increase funding for biodegradable PPE, or PPE that can be reused. This could discourage the production of non-biodegradable PPE so there is less of an impact on the planet.
attributes.additional_details: There are reports that regular PPE is going to waste every day in the NHS. The waste is then incinerated or even ends up in the oceans or landfill. It is very important to make a change to prevent devastating impacts to our environment and damage to much of the natural world. We have to take responsibility of this problem and take action.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Legalise Human Composting (Natural Organic Reduction)
attributes.background: Natural Organic Reduction, legal in 4 US states, is the gentle transformation of the human body into soil. Many feel a symbolic and spiritual significance of returning to the soil, and loved ones have a sense of ceremony; they can scatter, plant trees with, or donate remains to ecological projects.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK 80% of us choose cremation, with around 470,000 per year. For every one around 245 kg of carbon and many pollutants is released, totalling 115,000 tonnes yearly. Cremation is an important option, but Human Composting provides an environmentally friendly alternative. Fuel is saved and the carbon and nutrients of the body are kept. 

UK residents deserve the full spectrum of deathcare options, allowing everybody the chance to have their final wishes met. Therefore NOR should be legalised.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Ban the weedkillers aminopyralid and clopyralid due to risk of contamination.
attributes.background: I would like the Gov. to ban these herbicides due to increasing cases of contamination in manure and compost. These herbicides can ruin gardens and allotments for many years as the chemicals persist in manure and compost. My allotment has recently been contaminated, and many crops have failed.
attributes.additional_details: Throughout the Covid-19 Crisis more people than ever have turned to growing their own vegetables. Thus, the "lottery" of possible contamination in manure and compost, whereby whole crops can be lost and gardens and allotments ruined for years, should be mitigated by a ban on the sale of aminopyralid and clopyralid in the UK. If we are to move towards a more sustainable relationship with nature, and a more secure and healthy relationship to our food, such cases of contamination must be avoided.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Stop schools selling or giving students single-use plastic water bottles
attributes.background:
We are pleading for the Government to stop schools across England from selling single-use plastic water bottles, or giving these to students.

We're saying no to single-use plastic water bottles in school. Please help support us in our mission.
attributes.additional_details:
We know that producing plastic bottles is bad for the planet. As a family, we spend a lot of time going around litter picking, we are keen to protect nature, we want to help protect and keep plastic-free for us and future generations. That’s why we want the Government to think of the environment and stop schools selling single-use plastic water bottles, or giving these to students.

 

Please help us to raise awareness of this issue by signing our petition, and hopefully, the Government will hear our collective voices and consider making a change.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Ban the shooting of birds for sport
attributes.background: Make a law against the shooting of birds for sport, and any associated activities.
attributes.additional_details: Shooting birds for sport Is barbaric and has no real sense in 2021 or in most opinions, ever. Shooting 'Game' has been ongoing in various countries, and could be contributing to species going extinct or becoming critically endangered. As we all strive every day to do the right thing, to help our natural habitat, whether it be helping to protect the bees, foxes, rabbits, snakes, or any other non-human animal, we must come together to end this old tradition.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban new housing developments in National Parks
attributes.background: The Government should stop all new housing developments in national parks across the UK. The New Forest authority is accepting plans for a new large development on national park land near Calshot. Developments like this should not be allowed.
attributes.additional_details: The impact on nature can be absolutely irreversible when major housing developments occur. Conserving nature and biodiversity should be of paramount importance to everyone. National parks are a haven for thousands of species, in some instances that are endemic to particular areas. This petition's values goes beyond economics, with a higher purpose of bio-conservation and the protection of wildlife.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Establish a national tree-planting scheme for graduating students
attributes.background: It is vitally important to protect our environment, and tree planting is one way of helping to do so. Planting your own tree is very rewarding and has the potential to inspire and encourage local communities to protect and look after their own patches of nature.
attributes.additional_details: In the Philippines, it is a legal requirement for all graduating students from elementary school to college, to plant 10 trees each. The bill, "Graduation Legacy For the Environment Act," is estimated to plant 525 billion trees over the course of one generation. Our environment is at a tipping point, and we urgently need innovative solutions like this to not only combat the crisis, but also to encourage local communities to care and protect for their own patches of local nature.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban formaldehyde in motorhome/caravan toilet fluid products
attributes.background: Some blue toilet chemicals contain formaldehyde, a known human carcinogen. The government should ban the use of formaldehyde in motorhome/caravan toilet fluids because safer alternatives (including 100% natural products) are now commercially available.
attributes.additional_details:
Formaldehyde is a highly toxic systemic poison that is absorbed well by inhalation. The vapour is a severe respiratory tract and skin irritant and may cause dizziness or suffocation. Contact with formaldehyde solution may cause severe burns to the eyes and skin.

Fomaldehyde-based toilet fluids are unsuitable for all campsites with septic tanks and can seriously damage the natural environment if spilled.

We should not be allowing the use of such a dangerous ingredient in blue toilet fluids.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the development of Wind Farms within AONBs and National Parks in England
attributes.background: We want a ban to all Wind Farm developments within the environmentally designated AONBs and National Parks. This is due to the onshore wind farms having too much of an impact in terms of Sustainable Development
attributes.additional_details: We must get the principles of Sustainable Development embedded in decision making. Large private owned and public listed companies are exploiting our natural environment. This is wrong and is designed purely for profit. The UK Government should also encourage the devolved administrations to implement similar bans in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Pressure Israel to release Palestinian prisoners who are vulnerable to COVID-19
attributes.background: We call on the British Government to pressure the Israeli authorities to release all Palestinian children, elders and women prisoners from its jails because they are most vulnerable to being infected by the Corona Virus COVID -19
attributes.additional_details: While the Israeli authorities have recently released other prisoners as a precautionary measure against the spread of the Corona virus, the Palestinian prisoners remain incarcerated. This puts them at a greater risk of contracting the virus given the conditions under which they are held and the highly contagious nature of this virus.

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

attributes.action: Exempt tips for staff in the hospitality industry from tax
attributes.background: Due to the uncertain and gift-like nature of Tips given by customers I feel there shouldn't be any tax on these. Therefore I am hoping to open a discussion on the exemption of taxing tips given in the hospitality industry.
attributes.additional_details: I feel this would provide an extremely welcome boost to an industry currently on its knees and would show workers that concern is there especially considering this will apply to an extremely high number of staff on minimum wage etc.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Increase fixed penalty fines for littering
attributes.background: Penalties need to be increased to a level which shows that the authorities and society will no longer tolerate this antisocial, selfish behaviour, detrimental to the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
We have seen scenes across England of littered strewn parks, nature reserves, beaches and open spaces recently. Litter can have an effect on residents, people’s health, the economy, business, tourism, on crime and anti-social behaviour, and of course, on the environment.
 
'A Green Future: Our 25 Year Plan to Improve the Environment', sets out what the Government will do to improve the environment within a generation. Increasing consequences for littering could have an immediate positive environmental effect.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Keep retained EU environmental laws until equal or stronger UK laws introduced
attributes.background: The Retained EU Law (Revocation & Reform) Bill will remove EU-derived law protecting air, water, wildlife, land and waste in 2023. We want these laws to be retained until replacement legislation is passed which delivers equal or stronger protection for nature than retained EU law.
attributes.additional_details: UK governments in the past decade have variously promised to be "the greenest government ever" and "to be the first generation that leaves the environment in a better state than that in which we inherited it". But the EU Law Bill risks creating a "gun-at-the-head" deadline for replacing retained EU law, rather than removing retained laws when Parliament has formulated and passed equal or stronger UK law. We believe spending valuable Parliamentary time on the latter would be the better option.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Don't close zoos, wildlife parks & rehabilitation centres.
attributes.background: In light of newly considerations re tighter national rules to combat COVID, I urge the government not to consider the closure of zoos, wildlife parks and rehabiltation centres, unless there is verifiable effidence that imcreased infections are linked to visits of such venues.
attributes.additional_details: Zoos, wildlife parks and rehabilitation centres have taken a significant financial impact that is still threatening the continuation of these businesses. These places provide vital contributions to maintain our natural environment, to prevent the extinction of endangered species, to help injured wildlife and educate about our natural world, on which we all rely. Their closure may lead to the death of animals and the loss of many jobs.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Reform food, energy, environmental and fishing policy to save the planet
attributes.background: Following the airing of David Attenborough’s programme “Life on our planet”, the Government should take action and implement new laws, restrictions and taxes to: reduce meat production and consumption, switch to 100% renewable energy, stop all deforestation and ban over-fishing.
attributes.additional_details: We are at a critical tipping point. If we do not make changes now, it will be too late. In a matter of less than 10 years, we could see irreversible change that will have devastating impacts for the planet, and our species. We need to start acting on what the experts & natural world is telling and showing us in order to save the planet. We are an influential nation - if we create lasting change, others will follow and we will make the difference desperately needed.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the words "plant", "grass" & "tree" when used to sell plastic substitutes
attributes.background: Ban the use of nouns of "plant", "grass" and "tree" in advertising & selling plastic substitutes. We believe using these words is misleading, confusing and false.  EU's Court of Justice ruled in 2017 that plant-based products could not use the words ‘milk’, ‘cream’, etc. The same should apply here.
attributes.additional_details: A plant is a "living thing that grows in earth, in water, or on other plants, usually has a stem, leaves, roots, and flowers, and produces seeds". Grass is a "a low, green plant that grows naturally." A tree is "a tall plant that has a wooden trunk and branches that grow from its upper part". We believe using these nouns implies plastic products are natural, and is misinformation and misleadingly entices buying. Plastic has no proven natural benefits to the earth system.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Extend the definition of ‘looked after’ children
attributes.background: The Government should include children placed in accommodation under a local authority’s education functions, including SEN children, within the definition of ‘looked after’ children.
attributes.additional_details:
Children deserve protection from harm, to be gifted the best start to adulthood. For children in care, entering adulthood is naturally a challenging time. However, for many children in care who haven't acquired 'looked after child' status doors are closed, and accessing help is limited.

Children with Special Educational Needs, accommodated in Children’s Homes through an LA's Education Functions, are not guaranteed 'looked after' status in law. This means they do not have access to an Independent Reviewing Officer, do not have to be visited by a Social Worker, and cannot access most care leaving services.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Report daily SARS-CoV-2 variants of concern & variants under investigation data.
attributes.background: Parliament should ensure that the appropriate government departments put in place robust arrangements for recording, reporting, tracking, monitoring, scrutiny, and publication of all vital information regarding variants of concern and variants under investigation. Reports should be published daily.
attributes.additional_details: The Government's Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies recently noted that, "the impact of any importation of new variants will depend on the properties of that variant, in particular the degree of immune escape from vaccine-induced or naturally-acquired immunity". This statement emphasises the importance of having timely, accurate, detailed, daily data about the occurrence of variants; including details of how outbreaks are being managed and the actions being taken to protect the public.
